title: @riot, do i get banned if i type in allchat "CAW CAW MOTHERFUCKER" when playing Fiddlesticks?
body: I'm recently playing fiddle support, can i type "CAW CAW MOTHERFUCKER" when i ult-stopwatch-double the enemy bot lane or am i toxin?

> [{quoted}](name=Reket DeAlk,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=dN1Et655,comment-id=001200000000,timestamp=2017-12-04T18:16:45.207+0000)
>
> Calling someone a motherfucker will get you punished. Simply saying motherfucker will not.

But by that logic, wouldn't simply saying moron in chat go unpunished as well? Since you're not calling anyone a moron, you're just saying the word. I mean, if you're saying caw caw motherfucker, you're technically directing it at someone, aren't you?

And also, nice downvotes for simply asking for clarification about how punishments work. What a great community.

It all comes down to context. Simply stating a bad word is not punishable. If the context you use it in has nothing to do with harassing a teammate for their mistake then you have nothing to fear.

But you know what context you are using it in when you use it. If a teammate makes a mistake and you say moron in chat, nobody is going to be confused or think you are doing anything other than referring to that player as a moron.

Use common sense dude. Don't insult others. It's really not that hard to figure out. You're not going to be excused or have your ban lifted just for claiming the protection of a 'technicality' and saying, "Well I didn't say it to insult them... :P" To anyone who would try that, I just have this to say: Dude you know what you did, learn from it and get over it.

This is so true. I think people forget that Riot can see when you said something. They can see what happened in the game, they can even go rewatch the game if they want to to see what happened when you said something.

Except they don't. They rely entirely on an automated system that doesn't take anything into context. Sure, if they want to, they can go back and look. But countless players have been chat-restricted/banned for chat that is never looked at in context. Either they look at context, or they don't. Pick one, Chermog.
Did you ever consider that it's likely the automated system can take those kinds of factors into account?

It isn't.

It's easily abused.

Over half a year ago, I distinctly recall playing 1 game that day getting quite emotional but at most, responding back with "stfu keyboard warrior and **** you" after being the black sheep of not only my team, but a few people on the enemy team as well.

Yes, I know the proper response is to mute and move on, but when your teammates already call you "retarded or autistic" when you're genuinely trying and not screwing around, is there no understanding or leeway at all? i.e. **context**? When not just 2 or 3 people are on your ass, but 6/10 people in the game? For no clear reason? Sorry, I'm not an upstanding League player I guess. I'm toxic. 

I reported them and was pretty confident in the fact that I wouldn't be chat restricted since my responses were very minimal given the situation. But context did not matter. "You should have muted" "You shouldn't engage with trolls". 

1 game. I log on a few days later and I have a 10 game chat restriction. I have gotten zero notification as to their punishments, even though our Tristana told me to drink bleach, used autistic insults, our Brand kept asking to report me in all chat and kept calling me a retard, our Lee Sin kept saying "GG" after feeding first blood and said he didn't care if that account got banned because he's already made at least 9.

Haven't bought RP since. 

I don't agree with that.
